snippet: In spite of Michael Beasley's reputation of often scoring on isolation plays, statistics show he provides a net benefit to Minnesota's offense without damaging its assist numbers.
abstract: In spite of Michael Beasley's reputation of often scoring on isolation plays, statistics show he provides a net benefit to Minnesota's offense without damaging its assist numbers.
lead_paragraph: Over his last season and change in Minnesota, forward Michael Beasley has developed a deserved reputation as a somewhat counterproductive offensive player. There is no disputing his ability to score in volume; a No. 2 overall pick by the Heat in 2008, Beasley put up 21.4 points per 36 minutes last season as the Timberwolves' primary offensive option, placing him in the N.B.A.'s top 15 per-minute scorers.

headline.main: Joking Aside, Timberwolves Are Better With Beasley
